content.question: A positively charged rod is brought close to a charged particle hanging on a string. The particle is observed to move toward the rod. Which of the following claims correctly describes the observation?

choices.label: The hanging particle is positively charged and is attracted to the positively charged rod.
The hanging particle is negatively charged and is attracted to the positively charged rod.
The hanging particle could be positively charged or negatively charged depending on which side of the hanging particle the rod is brought close to.
There is not enough information to determine whether the hanging particle is positively charged or negatively charged.

content.answer: The hanging particle is negatively charged and is attracted to the positively charged rod.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
